title: Sri Lanka main opposition defies curfew to protest
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s main opposition Samagi Jana Balawegaya defied a curfew to stage a protest in the capital Colombo two days after the country was placed under emergency rule as a forex crisis created power, fuel and medicine shortages.
“We will protect #democracy in #SriLanka,” opposition legislator Harsha de Silva said in a twitter.com message.

Several dozen opposition legislators moved out of opposition leaders towards independence square to reach the statue of first independent Prime Minister D S Senanayake, considered the ‘father of the nation.
Nation-wide protests were to be held at 1500 hours Sunday but President Gotabaya Rajapaksa invoked emergency regulations Friday and imposed curfew from 600pm Saturday.
Social media was blocked overnight as protestors defied curfews to gather at several locations.
